conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have visible height/thickness, multiple faces per wall are visible, interior volume reads clearly, and the camera is at an elevated angled/isometric-like viewpoint with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion of walls with clean corners and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. Minor simplification/abstraction in some wall-top/cap detailing but overall solid.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room adjacency matches (open kitchen/living left, bedroom upper area, bathroom core-right, stairs along right). However kitchen geometry differs (2D shows L-shape + island/sink; 3D shows a single run). Openings/windows do not fully match the 2D plan (notably bottom-wall window sequence appears missing/altered). Some doorway detailing (bath/inner doors) appears simplified/possibly missing.

interior_elements.notes: Major elements present: bed in bedroom, sofa + dining table/chairs in living, kitchen appliances/cabinets, bathroom tub/toilet/sink. Missing/changed island/peninsula from the 2D plan and some storage/closet elements are simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear and readable with consistent materials and good visibility. No text/UI clutter. Minor ambiguity in a few opening locations due to viewpoint and simplification.

detected_errors.description: Kitchen layout deviates from 2D plan (L-shape + island/sink in plan vs simplified straight run in 3D).
Window/door opening placement and counts do not fully match the 2D plan (notably bottom-wall windows and some interior door detailing).
Plan-indicated kitchen island/central counter is missing; some built-in/closet features appear simplified.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric fidelity, but with noticeable deviations in kitchen geometry and partial mismatch/simplification of openings versus the 2D plan.
